intro: Stackhousia viminea, commonly known as the slender stackhousia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and prefers full sun exposure. Stackhousia viminea is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
